storyInfo: Skyfire is back in Victoria once again, where an old classmate hears she now works for the council, and looks to grease the gears on his factory expansion via the Mountbelan heiress.

attributes.content: You hear? The Mountbelan girl's back in old Victoria, smack dab in the middle of Caladon.
Here? I thought she'd be off in a bigger city. There's no place more infected than this, and didn't it have a bout of Reunion or something too? I thought she couldn't stand all that?
She's working for the council.
Ahh—the council. The venerable city council. She probably has it easy as could be.
Is that all you're interested in? I thought you'd be delighted.
Delighted? About what?
Haven't you been wanting a leg up for that factory of yours? We all know she's got her head up her behind, and you know what she's done before. She hates the Infected to death.
So now she's working for the council. You find her, let her know what's in it for her, tell her about your factory, and there you go—
...What is this? An invitation?
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: 'We cordially invite you on this day... to share in our celebrations. Champagne tasting and tours... tonight at 8 P.M. We hope to see you there.'
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: A class reunion? Sometimes it really does puzzle me how something both so time-wasting, and so difficult to refuse, ever got folded into 'etiquette.'
attributes.name: Skyfire
Skyfire
attributes.content: I'll go once hours are over. I just hope the rotten lot of them don't give me any—

attributes.name: Skyfire
attributes.content: Mmph. No, bad. No need for anger on the job.
Let's just get ourselves straight to work.
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: Oh, hello, old friend. Just last week we met at the drinking party. Your magnificent visage stole the breath from quite a number of people! They've been clamoring to have you back again!
attributes.name: Haughty Noble Alumnus

attributes.content: My face, is it?
attributes.name: Self-Satisfied Noble Alumna

attributes.content: They're just after my estate. I'm not sure I can blame them; it turned me what would normally be a year's profits in a few short months.
attributes.name: Self-Satisfied Noble Alumna

attributes.content: Aren't people still praising Count Adam's dashing appearance, even though his hair resembles corn silk more than anything by now?
attributes.name: Self-Satisfied Noble Alumna

attributes.content: *cough*! You haven't changed a whit.
attributes.name: Haughty Noble Alumnus

attributes.content: Now, profits, though, you'll want to hear about my winery. I think you'll find that's the real last say...
attributes.name: Haughty Noble Alumnus

attributes.content: (Jockeying with each other, flaunting assets, backstabbing the absent. Hmph. These people don't change one jot.)
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: Count Ambulas, my factory has been set on the right track, and I owe it to your kind attention! But before it can tithe you further profits, I will need just the tiniest sum more...
attributes.name: Opportunistic Merchant Alumnus

attributes.content: Ah-hah-hah, it's a true honor you should still remember me! I was sat right behind you, if you remember!
attributes.name: Wheedling Merchant Alumnus

attributes.content: If you'd be willing to cast an eye over my estate, I'd be greatly thankful! ...Ah, I see. Sorry to bother you...
attributes.name: Wheedling Merchant Alumnus

attributes.content: (Treating a dinner party as a springboard up... these people do love their flattery. Honestly... what a typical sight.)
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: (I've been here for long enough—it's time I left. It'll take a while to get back to Caladon too.)
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: Miss Mountbelan?
attributes.name: Wheedling Merchant Alumnus

attributes.content: Hm?
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: Miss Mountbelan, it really is you!
attributes.name: Wheedling Merchant Alumnus

attributes.content: You must try some of the champagne tonight, I'll bring you a glass...
attributes.name: Wheedling Merchant Alumnus

attributes.content: Of all the places to meet you! Do you still remember me? I was sat right behind you in class. I see you've found yourself a fine job!
attributes.name: Wheedling Merchant Alumnus

attributes.content: Excuse me. If it's nothing urgent, I have my own business to attend to.
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: Ah, well, here's the thing, I hear you're working for the council now, and I just so happen to run a little factory. It's nothing too grand, but...
attributes.name: Wheedling Merchant Alumnus

attributes.content: With just the right opportunity, it could turn a profit on par with Isabella's estate! And naturally I'd give you—my good official—a fabulous token of my thanks.
attributes.name: Wheedling Merchant Alumnus

attributes.content: So, for example, anything council-related...
attributes.name: Wheedling Merchant Alumnus

attributes.content: I have absolutely no interest.
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: (Could it... be this girl has no clue what my factory even does?)
attributes.name: Wheedling Merchant Alumnus

attributes.content: (She's not one bit less sheltered. Nobles... snooty bloodline-obsessed elitists, the lot of them... Am I not being deferential enough for you—?!)
attributes.name: Wheedling Merchant Alumnus

attributes.content: Miss Mountbelan, my factory is right here in Caladon, if you didn't know. And it's only even here thanks to the great pains I know you and the councilors have gone to.
attributes.name: Wheedling Merchant Alumnus

attributes.content: Haven't you always hated those lowly brutes? I know they paid quite the rightful price for what they did to your beloved pet.
attributes.name: Wheedling Merchant Alumnus

attributes.content: But now—thanks to these policies—the council has finally turned its head our way, hasn't it? Those lowly people exist for our sakes, and I've picked up by now on how to make good and proper use of them—
attributes.name: Wheedling Merchant Alumnus

attributes.content: If I could just grasp one inch further, I'm sure results would be even more plentiful. And you, Miss Mountbelan, would have me doing all I could to repay your kindness!
attributes.name: Wheedling Merchant Alumnus
Skyfire
attributes.content: (How about I burn him to—

attributes.name: Skyfire
attributes.content: No. No.)
You know, I'm finding it a little oddly hot in here.
attributes.name: Wheedling Merchant Alumnus

attributes.content: Miss Mountbelan, what do you say? How about we step outside and chat?
attributes.name: Wheedling Merchant Alumnus
Skyfire
attributes.content: (Can I really not just—

attributes.name: Skyfire
attributes.content: No, no. I can't.)
Here's my business card. Please, by all means!
attributes.name: Wheedling Merchant Alumnus

attributes.content: ...Hrmmph. Let me see.
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: 'Barum's Works'?
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: Exactly!
attributes.name: Wheedling Merchant Alumnus

attributes.content: I see. Well, Barum's Works.
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: Have you heard of it?
attributes.name: Wheedling Merchant Alumnus

attributes.content: Of course.
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: We've discussed plans for new acts where your factory has served as a case study.
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: My professor and I kept tabs on your factory in private too. 'Barum's Works' was top of the list that came in.
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: Ah, really! Now that's an honor! Then may I...?
attributes.name: Wheedling Merchant Alumnus

attributes.content: I've already signed a non-disclosure agreement.
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: Of course! Naturally you wouldn't be the sort to break confidentiality! I was just hoping you could let me in on a little of the council chatter, some teatime topics, maybe we could chew the cud on this or that.
attributes.name: Wheedling Merchant Alumnus

attributes.content: Such as...
attributes.name: Wheedling Merchant Alumnus

attributes.content: Such as the act we're imminently proposing regarding working hours?
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: Exactly!
attributes.name: Wheedling Merchant Alumnus

attributes.content: If I could invite you to my factory for a look around, I'd be utterly honored...
attributes.name: Wheedling Merchant Alumnus

attributes.content: Miss Mountbelan, you have my gratitude for deigning to come here. I had them clean the place thorough a few days ago. Not a speck of dust left!
attributes.name: Wheedling Merchant Alumnus

attributes.content: Didn't I tell you I was here to see things as they are?
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: Oh, well, cleaning up some dust off to the side wouldn't impact your understanding of how our factory operates.
attributes.name: Wheedling Merchant Alumnus

attributes.content: I don't mean to boast, but you see, the scale of this place—
attributes.name: Wheedling Merchant Alumnus

attributes.content: Not top of the line for Caladon, but remarkable all the same.
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: I see facilities and protective measures are kept in good order. In the light of present regulations, your site is a clean pass.
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: Security measures are also fully replete as stipulated.
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: Miss Mountbelan, I see you've been underestimating me. It's only natural such fundamental work is well done.
attributes.name: Wheedling Merchant Alumnus

attributes.content: How about we take a look at the workshop? It's Infected, however, so even with protective measures ready, I'm sure you wouldn't want to go insi—
attributes.name: Wheedling Merchant Alumnus

attributes.content: I would.
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: Miss Mountbelan?
attributes.name: Wheedling Merchant Alumnus

attributes.content: Ah, I see, it's that kerfuffle from a few years ago. You want to see if there's any traces of that whole... Reunion Movement inside?
attributes.name: Wheedling Merchant Alumnus

attributes.content: Hm?
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: Mm, yes, Reunion.
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: My workers here have all gone through background checks, but you can rest assured, if you're displeased to see anyone in there, you can be sure I'll—
attributes.name: Wheedling Merchant Alumnus

attributes.content: I'll have to see for myself.
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: Yes, I understand, you'd better get your protective gear on, then. I'll just have to brave the elements...
attributes.name: Wheedling Merchant Alumnus

attributes.content: Is this the place? Where are the workers?
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: Miss Mountbelan, I didn't think you'd be so concerned with a place like this. How could I possibly have you mingling with Infected? I've ordered them all out for the time being, and the purifier installations are on at maximum.
attributes.name: Wheedling Merchant Alumnus

attributes.content: Let's not stay in here for too long. I'll be honest, this is my first time in here too... er, in a while, I mean.
attributes.name: Wheedling Merchant Alumnus

attributes.content: Ah. I'm just taking a look around.
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: After all, by your accounts, this place has made you a pretty penny, so my interest is natural. Moreover, did you forget? I and my professor have been keeping a watch on your factory for some time now.
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: Yes, and I'm honored for it.
attributes.name: Wheedling Merchant Alumnus

attributes.content: Infected are both convenient and less demanding in the way of assurances. I have to thank the council for providing such a fine workforce.
attributes.name: Wheedling Merchant Alumnus

attributes.content: What are those?
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: Ah, surveillance devices.
attributes.name: Wheedling Merchant Alumnus

attributes.content: We both know, you see, how people tend to skive without motivation or supervision.
attributes.name: Wheedling Merchant Alumnus

attributes.content: And these riot shields?
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: Ahh. Even less of a concern. Infected don't take simply to discipline, nor are they content with what they have. I imagine you know better than I do. Without a method or two at hand, they'd never stay placid.
attributes.name: Wheedling Merchant Alumnus

attributes.content: Aren't you concerned that just leaving your riot control gear here might cause fear in the Infected, even elicit disorder?
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: Well... hah-hah, you worry too much, Miss Mountbelan.
attributes.name: Wheedling Merchant Alumnus

attributes.content: They don't see it.
attributes.name: Wheedling Merchant Alumnus

attributes.content: They don't what...?
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: —Miss Mountbelan, we've been in here for a while now. Should we step out? Even with all the precautions, there's always an off-chance.
attributes.name: Wheedling Merchant Alumnus

attributes.content: Let's take the lift out and pull that gear off, and take some deep breaths. Nice, deep breaths!
attributes.name: Wheedling Merchant Alumnus

attributes.content: Miss Mountbelan, old friend, there's no one but you and me in this lift, so let me be a little honest with you. This may just interest you more in my factory?
attributes.name: Wheedling Merchant Alumnus

attributes.content: Don't be too disappointed with what you've seen. Putting all that aside, you've noticed, haven't you?
attributes.name: Wheedling Merchant Alumnus

attributes.content: The surveillance and riot control staff, and the armed installations. You can't make all your money in the open, you know that.
attributes.name: Wheedling Merchant Alumnus

attributes.content: What's down below us is the real deal.
attributes.name: Wheedling Merchant Alumnus

attributes.content: But it's too filthy underground. You won't need to cast your own eye.
attributes.name: Wheedling Merchant Alumnus

attributes.content: I see.
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: Mm. I am very—satisfied with what you've just told me.
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: It's very interesting.
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: Once again, the alumnus feels the temperature rise a notch.
He ascribes this to Skyfire's excitement at the opportunity. To make money, to continue trampling over the disgorged masses.
Even beasts in the wild know they should only pounce when they see prey. If I didn't show you the genuine article, I worry you'd be left cold.
attributes.name: Wheedling Merchant Alumnus

attributes.content: Factories are a garden variety thing. I need something new in the works too, you know?
attributes.name: Wheedling Merchant Alumnus

attributes.content: Ha! So I see.
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: Hah-hah-hah-hah, well, come, Miss Mountbelan. I've had this fine tipple stashed for years. Let's toast!
attributes.name: Wheedling Merchant Alumnus

attributes.content: To your sponsoring a factory of much potential, and my soon-to-be debut upon a bigger stage!
attributes.name: Wheedling Merchant Alumnus

attributes.content: Hahaha.
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: Cheers.
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: Skyfire's temperature rises, starting from underfoot.
In just a blink, a fraction of a second, she could burn this whole factory to nothing, and save all the people trapped below.
But in another blink, she suppresses the smoldering rage in her head.
Professor, did you need me?
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: 'Infected rioters identifying as 'Reunion' gravely hurt by organization known as 'King's Wand.'' That's what the news is reporting.
attributes.name: Councilor Angst

attributes.content: Professor, they killed Phil!
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: And how you resolved the issue was hardly the only way to do so.
attributes.name: Councilor Angst

attributes.content: If you let an eye for an eye blind you, Miss Mountbelan, then that is altogether contrary to how I've taught you.
attributes.name: Councilor Angst

attributes.content: Have you forgotten what I first told you?
attributes.name: Councilor Angst

attributes.content: The issue of the Reunion Movement is not solely a matter of the Infected. If you wish to continue the way you're going, then go to the place I recommended you. Deepen your studies. See the outside, and I mean that.
attributes.name: Councilor Angst

attributes.content: Don't disappoint me, Miss Mountbelan. You're a student of plentiful notions. Don't let your own emotions stifle you. Look past them.
attributes.name: Councilor Angst

attributes.content: Flames can burn anything you want to cinders, but they can't solve problems.
Stood there in the factory, she pinches the wine glass and settles her somewhat unsteady breathing.
I imagine you know when the next council meeting is.
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: Look forward to the good news.
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: Hah, hahahah, thank you, Miss Mountbelan!
attributes.name: Wheedling Merchant Alumnus

attributes.content: Here's the long and short of it, Professor.
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: Barum's Works. One of the factories on the list when we put together the investigation into Infected rights.
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: I'd consulted you on it, whereupon we decided to send a spy to sniff around in secret. I've assembled a file on the inner workings of his factory.
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: On top of which, I find out just a few days ago that this factory's owner was one of my very own classmates.
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: I initially wanted to send the whole thing up in flames—of course, I knew that was utterly wrong, and it wouldn't solve a single thing, just pile meaningless hassle on instead.
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: But I revile, HATE, what he did. Seeking me out at a dinner function hoping for a backdoor into the council, brazenly spilling all about his factory's machinations right in front of a Member—
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: His doing so is evidence that dozens upon dozens before him did the same, that countless people took to the same methods for their own underhanded gains.
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: Professor, it's obviously afoul of current regulations. But they've tried it, and they've found out they don't get punished, they just reap the benefits. That's what got them all to start doing it.
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: Truth be told, I do remember him, and I know that 'sat behind me' spiel he gave was true in my case.
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: He said the same thing to every noble there, but he did sit in the seat right behind me.
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: He used to... not be like this.
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: He used to be—a good egg?
attributes.name: Councilor Angst

attributes.content: Not particularly, but he was hardly what he is now... I just wonder, was this all in his nature? I don't feel like it was, Professor.
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: He just... tried slipping through a regulatory loophole, and found nobody even cared. And he just kept inching on and on until he got to this state.
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: Are you—very conflicted right now, Miss Mountbelan?
attributes.name: Councilor Angst

attributes.content: No, Professor, I'm not conflicted at all. I just feel a little...
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: I'm not sure how to put it. But I know crystal clear what I ought to do.
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: Anne-Moses, if you could further debrief the Professor on this unscrupulous factory.
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: Yes, Miss Mountbelan.
attributes.name: Informant

attributes.content: I went into hiding near the factory per the intel Miss Mountbelan provided. My comms signal suffered severe interference whenever I approached its basement levels.
attributes.name: Informant

attributes.content: I speculate an internal comms shield is installed. The Infected workers within are completely cut off from the outside world.
attributes.name: Informant

attributes.content: Based on my observations over several days, deceased Infected have even been ported out in secret, and sent for disposal.
attributes.name: Informant

attributes.content: And armed personnel inside are dedicated to guarding the underground factory and its facilities. The Infected workers above have no inkling of what's going on. They simply assume it must be vital products or something being watched.
attributes.name: Informant

attributes.content: Based on the data provided by Miss Mountbelan, I surmise it's the previously missing groups of acutely ill Infected workers inside—
attributes.name: Informant

attributes.content: Being acutely ill makes treatment unnecessary, so they're used as disposable labor, shut in the factory underground to work to their deaths. Then the factory tosses them out, and replenishes with a new batch of Infected workers.
attributes.name: Informant

attributes.content: Hm... I see the picture now.
attributes.name: Councilor Angst

attributes.content: So, Miss Mountbelan, your method for dealing with this?
attributes.name: Councilor Angst

attributes.content: My report concludes here.
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: Mm, and why did we have to sit here for over ten minutes listening to you talk about this one piffling factory?
attributes.name: Councilors

attributes.content: This has little bearing on us. I hope you realize that.
attributes.name: Councilors

attributes.content: Did Councilor Angst really bring you here just to yank this little factory by the collar?
attributes.name: Councilors

attributes.content: What I wish to point out to you all is that the core of this incident is the missing Infected workers locked away here under armed surveillance, the curtailing of personal freedoms, even the covert disposal of the dead.
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: Adding to which, they work in environments of excessive Originium particulate concentration, without corresponding protective measures or communications equipment. Every point here is in violation of currently enacted policy.
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: Said enacted policy has led Caladon to be considered relatively relaxed on the Infected, hence why it could even draw such numbers of them to work here. It's the root of the city's development.
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: Should this incident leak, Caladon's external image will be in smithereens, and no more Infected will think to come here for work, full stop.
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: All present, I trust this scenario would not be to your delight.
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: Thus, this will amount to no proposal, but simply a factory... cleanup. And for Caladon's reputation, the proper proceedings will be needed for a rescue of the Infected workers in the council's name.
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: This seizure, too, must be in the council's name, for all the wider world to see.
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: As for the perspectives of all present—
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: We'll take a vote.
attributes.name: Councilors

attributes.content: Everyone, your views?
attributes.name: Councilors

attributes.content: Three days later
Wh—What the—?! Who are you?
attributes.name: Wheedling Merchant Alumnus

attributes.content: What are you coming in here for?!
attributes.name: Wheedling Merchant Alumnus

attributes.content: Ah, er, it's all Infected in here, you see...
attributes.name: Wheedling Merchant Alumnus

attributes.content: You lot, downstairs.
attributes.name: Victorian Officer

attributes.content: Downstairs? But downstairs is—
attributes.name: Wheedling Merchant Alumnus

attributes.content: Sir! Large number of unlawfully armed personnel discovered!
attributes.name: Victorian Soldier A

attributes.content: Sir! Unlawful communications shielding terminal discovered and dismantled!
attributes.name: Victorian Soldier B

attributes.content: Large quantity of Infected found underground!
attributes.name: Victorian Soldier A

attributes.content: Basement levels have been identified as an illegal factory!
attributes.name: Victorian Soldier B

attributes.content: Mm. Situation verified.
attributes.name: Victorian Officer

attributes.content: Per council regulations, we are hereby shutting this location down as the law compels.
attributes.name: Victorian Officer

attributes.content: And you—as stipulated by law—may not engage in any similar business for a five-year period.
attributes.name: Victorian Officer

attributes.content: —Evacuate the Infected!
attributes.name: Victorian Officer

attributes.content: Miss Mountbelan!
attributes.name: Wheedling Merchant Alumnus

attributes.content: Miss Mountbelan!!
attributes.name: Wheedling Merchant Alumnus

attributes.content: Ah, it's you... what is it?
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: You—My factory?!
attributes.name: Wheedling Merchant Alumnus

attributes.content: I had people turn up at my factory out of nowhere this morning, and even the underground to boot, they—what the hell happened?!
attributes.name: Wheedling Merchant Alumnus

attributes.content: Oh! You mean the factory seizure.
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: Didn't you ask me for help before?
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: There you go. I've helped you.
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: You caught word about me, yes, but you didn't catch on.
attributes.name: Skyfire

attributes.content: I'm not just a Member of the Council, I'm also a Rhodes Island Operator. If you're not familiar, perhaps I can illuminate you—
attributes.name: Skyfire
Skyfire
attributes.content: I work to resolve issues for the Infected.

attributes.name: Skyfire
attributes.content: And more importantly, I work to seek their rights for them.
